page.title: 01INTRODUCTION,CANON PYON AREA
page.content: Our block has parts of the Herefords. rural communities of Canon Pyon, Bush Bank, and Westhope.Westhope Hill,cider orchard and tree covered, dominates the landscape of fields and woods. The conically shaped{Pyon Hills}can be seen for many miles.An old Roman road, now the A4110 crosses the block. Bush Bank and modern Canon Pyon have grown up along the road.The centre of Canon Pyon village has moved half a mile from the church.The school is situated outside the village. Westhope has recently become repopulated with the renovation of many derelict cottages. The land is divided up into tenant or privately owned farms,with dairy and beef cattle,sheep,fruit & grain crops the chief commodities.Population is varied and many people commute to Hereford. The three villages have a well developed feeling of community.
